           Welcome!
          </h1>
          <p class="slide-subtitle" data-dynamic-mod="true" data-theme="slider_elements|1644788307380|slide_subtitle_options_subtitle_text">
           ISLANDS is a new international joint research Master programme of the University of Groningen, the University of the Aegean, the University of Iceland and the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria. It focuses on the development of knowledge on island particularities and the development of tools, skills and technology in order to reduce the gap between theory and practice concerning sustainability.
          </p>

      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          What is ISLANDS?
         </h2>
         <p class="" style="text-align: left;">
          Islands are special cases for Sustainable Development. Within the current global economic and social system islands in many cases face economic, social, political and cultural marginalization. Cooperation is needed in research and education on the ways to manage islands and raise capacity building in island communities. Understanding the problems and finding effective ways to develop the potential of islands requires international academic cooperation that looks beyond the specifics of individual islands. There is clearly a demand for a high quality Masters programme on sustainable development on islands that can enhance much required training and expertise in this field. This is why the University of Groningen, the University of the Aegean, the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria and the University of Iceland have joined forces to launch this high-level integrated study programme on islands at Master level.
          <br/>
         </p>
         <div class="">
         </div>
         <p class="lead">
          <span style="font-weight: 600;">
           Application deadline:
          </span>
         </p>

             <h3 class="post-title space-bottom-small">
              <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/iceland-copernicus-hackathon-2025/" rel="bookmark">
               From Iceland with Kelp: ISLANDS students win the 2025 Copernicus Hackathon
              </a>
             </h3>
             <p>
              ISLANDS students secured the first place at the Copernicus Ocean Hackathon 2025 in Reykjavík, Iceland. Their winning project is Kelpture, an advanced AI-powered tool designed to optimise kelp farming sites, highlighting how the innovative use of satellite data supports sustainable aquaculture practices and contributes to mitigating climate-related challenges within Iceland’s blue economy.

              </a>
             </h3>
             <p>

          <h1 class="slide-title">
           Welcome!
          </h1>
          <p class="slide-subtitle" data-dynamic-mod="true" data-theme="slider_elements|1644788307380|slide_subtitle_options_subtitle_text">
           ISLANDS is a new international joint research Master programme of the University of Groningen, the University of the Aegean, the University of Iceland and the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria. It focuses on the development of knowledge on island particularities and the development of tools, skills and technology in order to reduce the gap between theory and practice concerning sustainability.
          </p>

     <div class="features-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12" data-id="features--1" data-label="About" data-noir-inline-background-color="" id="about" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253); --noir-inline-background-color: #14191b;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          What is ISLANDS?
         </h2>
         <p class="" style="text-align: left;">
          Islands are special cases for Sustainable Development. Within the current global economic and social system islands in many cases face economic, social, political and cultural marginalization. Cooperation is needed in research and education on the ways to manage islands and raise capacity building in island communities. Understanding the problems and finding effective ways to develop the potential of islands requires international academic cooperation that looks beyond the specifics of individual islands. There is clearly a demand for a high quality Masters programme on sustainable development on islands that can enhance much required training and expertise in this field. This is why the University of Groningen, the University of the Aegean, the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria and the University of Iceland have joined forces to launch this high-level integrated study programme on islands at Master level.
          <br/>
         </p>
         <div class="">
         </div>
         <p class="lead">
          <span style="font-weight: 600;">
           Application deadline:
          </span>
         </p>
         <div class="">
          <br/>
         </div>
         <div class="" data-content-shortcode='mesmerize_display_widgets_area id="mesmerize_users_custom_widgets_areas_0" ' data-editable="true" data-name="ope-widgets-area">

           <div class="post-content card y-move bordered">
            <div class="post-thumbnail">
             <a class="post-list-item-thumb" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/iceland-copernicus-hackathon-2025/">
              <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="469" sizes="(max-width: 452px) 100vw, 452px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Winners.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Winners.jpg 452w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Winners-289x300.jpg 289w" width="452">

            <div class="col-padding col-padding-xs">
             <h3 class="post-title space-bottom-small">
              <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/iceland-copernicus-hackathon-2025/" rel="bookmark">
               From Iceland with Kelp: ISLANDS students win the 2025 Copernicus Hackathon
              </a>
             </h3>
             <p>
              ISLANDS students secured the first place at the Copernicus Ocean Hackathon 2025 in Reykjavík, Iceland. Their winning project is Kelpture, an advanced AI-powered tool designed to optimise kelp farming sites, highlighting how the innovative use of satellite data supports sustainable aquaculture practices and contributes to mitigating climate-related challenges within Iceland’s blue economy.
             </p>
             <a class="read-more link" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/iceland-copernicus-hackathon-2025/">
              Read more
             </a>

              <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="410" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-1024x410.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-1024x410.jpg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-300x120.jpg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-768x307.jpg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1.jpg 1470w" width="1024">

            <div class="col-padding col-padding-xs">
             <h3 class="post-title space-bottom-small">
              <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/islands-as-laboratories-for-sustainability-islas-summer-school-iceland-2025/" rel="bookmark">
               ISLAs 2025 Summer School in Iceland
              </a>
             </h3>
             <p>
              Explore sustainability and resilience in remote island communities at the ISLAs Summer School in Iceland’s Westfjords, 28th June–6th July 2025. Combining academic study with real-world experiences, this programme examines how communities adapt to environmental and socio-economic transitions.
             </p>
             <a class="read-more link" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/islands-as-laboratories-for-sustainability-islas-summer-school-iceland-2025/">

             <h3 class="post-title space-bottom-small">

               Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability (ISLAs) Summer School 2024
              </a>
             </h3>
             <p>
              We are excited and happy to share some highlights from the Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability (ISLAs) Summer/Winter School 2024. ISLAs is a yearly summer school initiative by the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Programme ISLANDS and the University of Groningen, Faculty of Spatial Sciences.

     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Programme Introduction
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {

   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="features-13 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-13" data-id="features--1" data-label="Intro" id="intro" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: center;">
          Welcome to the ISLANDS programme, a dynamic 2-year Research Master that delves into the fascinating intersection of Islands and Sustainability with a curriculum entirely taught in English.
Our program is tailored to provide a comprehensive blend of research and professional skills spanning spatial, social, and environmental sciences. Gain a systematic understanding of scientific theories that spotlight islands as distinctive and crucial places, all while exploring the natural and human-induced processes shaping their rich history, present, and future. Elevate your academic journey with ISLANDS, where local knowledge meets global perspectives.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col col-sm-6 col-md-3 space-bottom">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--1" data-label="Content" id="themes" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Islands focuses on two main themes
         </h2>
         <p class="lead">
          Understanding the distinct characteristics of islands, their socio-economical, geopolitical, and environmental impacts, and the development of policies tailored to address their specific challenges.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Developing tools, skills, and technology to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical sustainability applications.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row center-xs middle-xs">
        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="features-12-card-bordered-colored content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12-card-bordered-colored" data-id="features--3" data-label="Skills" id="skills" style="background-color: rgb(240, 247, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead">
          Students not only expand their knowledge, but also cultivate critical thinking and research abilities, enabling them to:
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             <span style="font-weight: 300;">
              Analyse environmental issues and establish holistic perspectives on their relationship with human activities on islands
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Navigate diverse information resources, delivering effective presentations, collaborating in multidisciplinary teams, and communicating professionally in English
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Evaluate environmental policies within various island contexts
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Create and assess environmental protection strategies for both private and public island organisations
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Evaluate development projects, plans, policies, and technologies from spatial, economical, legal, cultural, marketing, and environmental standpoints
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="features-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12" data-id="features--2" data-label="Structure" id="structure" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead">
          For an overview of the programme structure and courses offered in the programme, see our dedicated page on the programme structure.
         </p>
         <a class="button color2" data-cp-link="1" data-icon="fa-reorder" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/programme-introduction/programme-structure" rel="noopener" target="_self">
          <span class="button-icon fa fa-reorder">
          </span>
          Programme Structure
         </a>
         <p class="lead">
          Information about the application process and the application requirements are shown on our application form page.
         </p>
         <a class="button color2" data-cp-link="1" data-icon="fa-pencil" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/application-form" rel="noopener" target="_self">
          <span class="button-icon fa fa-pencil">
          </span>
          Apply here
         </a>
         <p class="">
          <br/>
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 400;">
           <span style="font-weight: 500;">
            Studying with special educational needs
           </span>
           <br/>
           <br/>
           <span style="font-weight: 300;">
            All partner universities in the ISLANDS programme offer support for students with special needs. Further information can be found on the website of each partner university, linked below, or by sending us an email.
           </span>
          </span>
          <br/>
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/education/student-service-centre/bijzondere-omstandigheden/studying-with-special-needs/?lang=en" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/education/student-service-centre/bijzondere-omstandigheden/studying-with-special-needs?lang=en" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           The University of Groningen﻿
          </a>
          –
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.aegean.edu/teaching-and-learning-support-office/" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.aegean.edu/teaching-and-learning-support-office" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           University of the Aegean
          </a>
          –
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.ulpgc.es/accion-social/atencionaestudiantescondi" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.ulpgc.es/accion-social/atencionaestudiantescondi" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
          </a>
          –
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://english.hi.is/student_counselling_centre" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://english.hi.is/student_counselling_centre" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           University of Iceland
           <span data-mce-bogus="1" data-mce-type="format-caret" id="_mce_caret">
            <span style="font-weight: 400;">
             ﻿
            </span>
           </span>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>

     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--2" data-label="After your Studies" id="after-your-studies" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          After Your Studies
         </h2>
         <p class="lead">
          Whether your passion lies in academia, research, policy development, or consultancy, the skills honed during your time in the programme will open doors to a myriad of opportunities. Graduates of the ISLANDS programme are well-equipped to contribute to cutting-edge research, shape sustainable policies, or provide valuable insights as consultants in the dynamic intersection of islands and sustainability. The possibilities are as vast as the ocean itself, offering a platform for you to make a meaningful impact in the professional landscape of your choosing. Your journey doesn’t conclude with the ISLANDS program; it sets the stage for a future where your expertise and insights are invaluable.
         </p>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

  <div class="site" id="page">
   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Programme Structure
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-9 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-9" data-id="content--1" data-label="Year 1" id="year-1" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          The ISLANDS programme spans two years, with four semesters totaling 120 EC. Each semester accounts for 30 EC. The program, following the University of Groningen’s Research Master course structure, is taught in English and structured into four half-semesters/blocks.
         </p>
         <a class="" data-cp-link="1" href="#">
          <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/795B129F-4863-4E17-8C79-C921FA784BC2-scaled.jpeg" title="795B129F-4863-4E17-8C79-C921FA784BC2"/>
         </a>
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          <br/>
          The ISLANDS programme offers a double degree. Successful completion grants students a Research Master degree in Spatial Sciences (Islands and Sustainability track) from the University of Groningen (120 EC) and a degree from the island-based partner university where they completed their mobility periods. The University of Groningen issues a certificate recognizing the completion of the double degree based on two constituent single degree programs.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          In the first year, you are at the University of Groningen for the first semester, and the second semester takes place at an island-based partner university. In the second year, the first semester is back at the University of Groningen, and the fourth semester concludes the programme at the same island-based partner university. Within the run of the two year ISLANDS programme, you have to take at least 15 EC of Methodological courses. Depending on the islands-based partner and the size of the Research Internship (10 or 15 EC), you have to take up to 25 EC of Thematic Courses next to the mandatory Islands, Insularity and Islanders course.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          You can find and overview of the programme structure below. For details about the programme structure and courses, refer to
          <a data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="../../partner-universities/" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/partner-universities" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           the individual university pages
          </a>
          . See the
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://ocasys.rug.nl/current/catalog/programme/GEREMAISL" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://ocasys.rug.nl/current/catalog/programme/GEREMAISL" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           Ocasys course catalog
          </a>
          for the courses you can take in the semesters at the RUG. Please refer to
          <a data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="../../partner-universities/" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/partner-universities" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           the individual university pages
          </a>
          for the courses offered in the second semester of the first year.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

Their winning project is Kelpture, an advanced AI-powered tool designed to optimise kelp farming sites, highlighting how the innovative use of satellite data supports sustainable aquaculture practices and contributes to mitigating climate-related challenges within Iceland’s blue economy.

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="features-12-card-bordered-colored content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12-card-bordered-colored" data-id="features--1" data-label="Requirements" data-noir-inline-background-color="" id="requirements" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); --noir-inline-background-color: #111517;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          <span style="text-align: left;">
           To submit your application, click the ‘Apply’ button located at the end of this page which opens the application form.
          </span>
          All applicants are required to submit the following documents to the Admissions Office:
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-graduation-cap bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              Bachelor’s diploma/A document indicating the name of your qualification in the original language (and if applicable, Master’s diploma)
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-file-text-o bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              List of grades/transcript of records of your Bachelor’s degree (and if applicable, Master’s degree)
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-file-text bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              Motivation letter (max two pages), which should include:
             </span>
             <br/>
             A clear expression of your interest in studying Islands and Sustainability.
             <br/>
             A demonstration of your drives and enthusiasm to become a researcher in this field.
             <br/>
             An explanation of your reasons for choosing one of our island universities for your compulsory mobility periods where you wish to spend your two mobility periods as part of your programme.
             <br/>
             Please address why you are the most suitable candidate and how the programme connects to your past and your future ambitions.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-briefcase bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              <br/>
              Detailed CV
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span style="font-weight: 300;">
               Please note that we only accept applications with a
               <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://europass.europa.eu/en/create-europass-cv" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://europass.europa.eu/en/create-europass-cv" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                Europass CV
               </a>
              </span>
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-university bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              One or two reference letters, preferably academic
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-id-card bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              <br/>
              A scanned copy of your passport
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-cogs bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              Use of Generative AI in applications
             </span>
             <br/>
             As part of the ISLANDS Master’s programme, we value authenticity, honesty, and the unique perspectives that each applicant brings. While we recognise the role of AI in today’s world, we encourage applicants to focus on conveying their genuine motivations and personal experiences in their applications. By crafting original and thoughtful letters, you help us gain a clear and meaningful understanding of your aspirations and your fit for our programme. If you choose to use AI tools as part of your process, please be open about it – transparency is an important part of our admissions process.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--2" data-label="Content" data-noir-inline-background-color="" id="dates" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253); --noir-inline-background-color: #14191b;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           Key Application Dates
          </span>
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 500;">
           Scholarship
          </span>
          applications are open from
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           November 1st
          </span>
          until the application deadline on
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           January 15th
          </span>
          for the upcoming autumn semester. Interviews for shortlisted applicants will be conducted in February and March.
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 500;">
           Self-funded
          </span>
          candidates can apply until
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           April 1st
          </span>
          each year, with the intention to start in the autumn semester of the same year. Interviews for these candidates may be held in April and May.
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           Make sure to prepare and submit all the required documents within the specified deadlines to ensure a complete application.
          </span>
         </p>
        </div>

  <div class="site" id="page">
   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Entry Requirements
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="features-12-card-bordered content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12-card-bordered" data-id="features--2" data-label="Selection Criteria" id="selection-criteria-1" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          Students will be shortlisted and selected based on the criteria listed below.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-graduation-cap bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Previous Education
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Applicants should hold an academic bachelor degree (of comparable level to a Dutch academic bachelor degree obtained at a Dutch Research University) in fields such as geography, urban/regional planning, environmental science/engineering, economics, tourism, political science or related fields. Additionally, a  minimum of at least 10 ECTS in statistics or equivalent statistical knowledge is required.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-bar-chart bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Grade Avarage
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Strong academic performance is a key factor. Applicants should typically have excellent study results with high grades at the university level (A range), usually within the top 10%. This is comparable to the Dutch grading system, with an average grade of at least 7.0 and at least 7.5 for a Bachelor thesis.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-language bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Language Test
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             English on Dutch VWO level or one of the following equivalents:
             <br/>
             IELTS overall band 6.5, no less than 6.5 on each section
             <br/>
             TOEFL internet based: Overall: 90 Reading: 21 Listening: 21 Speaking: 21 Writing: 24
             <br/>
             Please note that TOEFL MyBest Scores are not considered in the Admissions procedure
             <br/>
             Cambridge English: Cambridge certificate C1 Advanced or C2 Proficiency (formerly known as CAE/CPE)
             <br/>
             European Baccalaureate, English level L1 or L2
             <br/>
             Alternatively, you can request an exemption from the Admissions Board
             <b>
              after
             </b>
             you have been admitted to the programme.
             <br/>
             <br/>
             Automatic exemptions are available for native speakers or students with (to be) completed undergraduate programmes in one of the following countries: USA, UK, Ireland, New Zealand, Australia, Canada (English speaking provinces/territories), Antigua and Barbuda, The Bahamas, Barbados, Belize, Grenada, Guyana, Jamaica, Trinidad and Tobago, St Kitts and Nevis, St Lucia and St Vincent and the Grenadines.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-comments bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Assessment Interview
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Shortlisted applicants will undergo an interview as part of the admission procedure, during which their attitude, motivation, orientation and competence for a career in (scientific) research are evaluated. The interview will be scheduled after the Admissions Board has received and reviewed the required documents.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-graduation-cap bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Professional Experience
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Professional experience is not a mandatory requirement for admission. Professional experience can also not substitute for not meeting the academic requirements in terms of level of the previous education.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="footer footer-1">

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--1" data-label="Content" id="content-1" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          The participation fees include enrollment and participation in all teaching activities, along with full insurance coverage by AON for the enrolled students. However, they do not cover other expenses such as accommodation, living costs, travel expenses, or additional insurance policies.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Participation fees for students from
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           EU Member States and programme countries
          </a>
          <br/>
          <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
           € 4500 per year
          </span>
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Participation fees for students from
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           non-programme countries
          </a>
          <br/>
          <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
           € 9000 per year
           <br/>
          </span>
          The ISLANDS consortium may offer a partial waiver to selected self-funding students, unless they already have a scholarship that fully covers the tuition fees and living costs. The decision to grant a partial waiver to selected students will be based on the information provided in a waiver application form, which will be sent to individually selected students.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          The AON insurrance that is included in the participation fees is the
          <a data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.aonstudentinsurance.com/en/products/complete" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.aonstudentinsurance.com/en/products/complete" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           AON ICS Complete
          </a>
          .
          <br/>
          It provides coverage for medical expenses, emergency assistance, loss of or damage to personal belongings, personal liability, legal assistance and any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons, urgent health care and/or emergency hospital treatment or death. Subject to the terms and conditions of the Policy, benefits are payable to the beneficiary, as stated in the policy conditions, up to the maximum benefits as shown on the policy that will be provided.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Follow the link to the Student Life below to learn more about the cost of living in the cities where our consortium universities are located.
         </p>
         <a class="button color1" data-cp-link="1" data-icon="fa-life-bouy" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/student-life" rel="noopener" target="_self">
          <span class="button-icon fa fa-life-bouy">
          </span>
          Student Life
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

  <div class="site" id="page">
   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Scholarships
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--1" data-label="scholarships" id="scholarships" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           <span style="font-weight: 300;">
            Applicants can apply for an Erasmus  scholarship by indicating their interest in the application form (please be aware that the deadline for scholarship applications is January 15). An Erasmus Mundus scholarship is valued
            <span style="font-weight: 700;">
             at EUR 1400 per month and covers a total duration of 24 months.
            </span>
            This scholarship will contribute to the costs incurred by the students, including travel, visa, accommodation installation, and subsistence costs. Additionally, the participation fees for scholarship recipients are waived.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            An AON insurrance is included in the scholarship:
            <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.aonstudentinsurance.com/en/products/complete" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.aonstudentinsurance.com/en/products/complete" rel="noopener" target="_self">
             AON ICS Complete.
            </a>
            <br/>
            It provides coverage for medical expenses, emergency assistance, loss of or damage to personal belongings, personal liability, legal assistance and any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons, urgent health care and/or emergency hospital treatment or death. Subject to the terms and conditions of the Policy, benefits are payable to the beneficiary, as stated in the policy conditions, up to the maximum benefits as shown on the policy that will be provided.
           </span>
           <span style="font-weight: 300;">
            EU-funded scholarships will be available annually for on average 15 students. Admission to the degree programme and scholarship awards are determined by the Joint Admissions Board, which includes a representative from each university, with the Joint Programme Coordinator serving as the chairperson.
           </span>
           <span style="font-weight: 300;">
            It is important to note that, in accordance with the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master programme requirements, there is a residential eligibility criterion for scholarship applications. This criterion states that the study period must include at least two study periods in two different countries, which must be different from your country of residence when you apply.
           </span>
           This criterion specifically applies to potential applicants who are currently residing in the Netherlands, Greece, Spain, or Iceland.
          </span>
          <br/>
          For more information on the Erasmus Mundus Scholarships, please visit
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/opportunities-for-individuals/students/erasmus-mundus-joint-masters" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/opportunities-for-individuals/students/erasmus-mundus-joint-masters" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           the official website of the Erasmus Mundus EU programme.
          </a>
          <br/>
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 600;">
           Please note:
          </span>
          students who have already obtained an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees (EMJMD) scholarship or are former Erasmus Mundus Master/Doctoral Course scholarship holders are not eligible for an additional scholarship under the EMJMD action. Students benefiting from an EMJMD scholarship cannot benefit from another EU grant while pursuing their EMJMD studies.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>

        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         University of Groningen
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();

     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--2" data-label="Overview" id="overview" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Welcome to Groningen, a city located in the northern part of the Netherlands with a rich academic tradition dating back to its establishment in 1614. The University of Groningen (Rug) is at the heart of this city. Rug is internationally oriented, known for its distinguished history and notable alumni, including the first female student in the Netherlands, the first Dutch astronaut, and various Nobel Prize winners. Rug is a research university with a global outlook, consistently ranking among the top 100 on various influential lists. It comprises 11 faculties (with one located in the Frisian capital of Leeuwarden) and offers a diverse range of more than 120 Master’s degree programs, many of which are taught in English. With over 37,000 students, the university boasts a highly international student population, representing over 120 nationalities. The university is committed to connect education and research with sustainable and economic processes within society, focusing on three main spearheads: Energy, Healthy Ageing, and Sustainable Society.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-3372359F-9D6E-4732-B6C7-52E730EA40E3.jpeg" title="cropped-3372359F-9D6E-4732-B6C7-52E730EA40E3.jpeg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--6" data-label="Courses" id="courses" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: center;">
          Head to the University of Groningen course catalog to learn more about the courses you can study here
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://ocasys.rug.nl/current/catalog/programme/GEREMAISL" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://ocasys.rug.nl/current/catalog/programme/GEREMAISL" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           Ocasys course overview for MSc Spatial Sciences (research): Erasmus Mundus Islands and Sustainability
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row center-xs middle-xs">
        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

     <div class="team-2 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="team" data-export-id="team-2" data-id="team--2" data-label="Team" id="team" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Staff at Groningen University involved in the ISLANDS programme
         </h2>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols content-center-sm" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-3">
         <div class="card y-move no-padding bordered">
          <img alt="" class="face" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-Dimitris_Ballas.jpg.png" title="cropped-Dimitris_Ballas.jpg.png"/>
          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Prof. Dimitris Ballas
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Prof. Ballas is the ISLANDS programme director and local coordinator, and Professor of Economic Geography in the Faculty of Spatial Sciences at Groningen University. He has published widely in the fields of social and economic geography, social and spatial inequalities, regional science and Geoinformatics in the Social Sciences.
           </p>

          <img alt="" class="face" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/cropped-AAF4B4F5-44FA-4A16-8372-9C65DF8DCFE6_4_5005_c.jpeg" title="cropped-AAF4B4F5-44FA-4A16-8372-9C65DF8DCFE6_4_5005_c.jpeg"/>

          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Reinier Schoep
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Reinier Schoep is the Administrative Coordinator and (main) study advisor for the ISLANDS programme. He is there to support the consortium in all administrative processes related to the programme and for the students to support them during their admission process and during their entire period within the ISLANDS programme.
           </p>

          <img alt="" class="face" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/cropped-8136BBBD-3A12-47E5-BDA6-4F4D80F1B09A.jpeg" title="cropped-8136BBBD-3A12-47E5-BDA6-4F4D80F1B09A.jpeg"/>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {

                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);

     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         University of the Aegean
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();

   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--3" data-label="intro" id="overview" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Welcome to the city of Mytilene on Lesvos Island, home to the University of the Aegean’s Department of Geography. Established in 1984, the University of the Aegean (UAegean) is dedicated to pioneering new approaches in higher education, both in Greece and globally, and fostering regional development. Serving as a social and economic force, it plays a key role as Regional Innovator in the North and South regions of the Aegean Archipelago. Spread across six picturesque islands in the Aegean Archipelago, UAegean provides a distinctive natural, cultural, and human environment for contemporary studies in the ancient cradle of knowledge.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-6A5E729D-101F-4165-82B4-0EDA26F0B7BD.jpeg" title="cropped-6A5E729D-101F-4165-82B4-0EDA26F0B7BD.jpeg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--2" data-label="Courses" id="courses" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: center;">
          At the department of Geography at the University of the Aegean you will be able to further develop your research skills with a focus on spatial and geographical analysis and get in touch with terrestrial and marine spatial planning for and on islands. The courses that you will take are listed below.
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-8B0534AB-CB12-49D7-8F71-DFD386DA088C.jpeg" title="cropped-8B0534AB-CB12-49D7-8F71-DFD386DA088C.jpeg"/>
        </div>
       </div>

        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="team-2 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="team" data-export-id="team-2" data-id="team--1" data-label="Team" id="team" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          University of the Aegean staff involved in the ISLANDS programme
         </h2>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols content-center-sm" data-type="row">

          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Prof. Thanasis Kizos
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            <span style="font-family: Poppins, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">
             Thanasis Kizos is the local coordinator of ISLANDS in Lesvos. He teaches Planning and Island Geography in the Programme. He has a background in Agricultural Science and Environmental Management and Policy with publications and on planning on and for islands. You can see his work here and contact him here.
            </span>

            Efi Chatzi is responsible for organisational and managerial support of ISLANDS. She is the assistant of the local coordinator with organisational and financial responsibilities, helping students and academic staff. She is a PhD candidate at the University of the Aegean with a background in Geographic Information Systems and Cartography.

  <div class="site" id="page">
   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         University of Iceland
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--3" data-label="Overview" id="overview" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Welcome to Reykjavík, Iceland, the northernmost capital of any sovereign state in the world. This vibrant city is also home to the University of Iceland (Háskóli Íslands in Icelandic, often abbreviated as HÍ or UI), the country’s oldest and largest higher education institution. Established in 1911, the university has evolved from a modest start with only 45 students to its current stature, catering to approximately 12,500 students, with over 1,500 coming from all over the world.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-01-15-at-15.33.42.jpeg" title="WhatsApp Image 2024-01-15 at 15.33.42"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--2" data-label="Courses" id="courses" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          At the University of Iceland you will be able to further develop your research skills with a focus on Tourism Studies and/or Natural Hazards. You will choose between one Thematic Theoretical Specialisation course from the list below.
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-896B0755-0C85-40D0-B009-0F295359A18C-scaled-1.jpeg" title="896B0755-0C85-40D0-B009-0F295359A18C"/>
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          <br/>
          Or the Advanced and Specialized Research Methods course below.
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-8475CB46-3E13-42D0-BCC2-99CD8F96A9E0.jpeg" title="cropped-8475CB46-3E13-42D0-BCC2-99CD8F96A9E0.jpeg"/>
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          <br/>
          In addtion, all students take the following courses
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-AA5CD5B3-B216-42A3-9EC0-0A6EBA42C858.jpeg" title="cropped-AA5CD5B3-B216-42A3-9EC0-0A6EBA42C858.jpeg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row center-xs middle-xs">
        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="team-2 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="team" data-export-id="team-2" data-id="team--1" data-label="Team" id="team" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Staff at the University of Iceland involved in the ISLANDS programme
         </h2>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols content-center-sm" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-4">
         <div class="card y-move no-padding bordered">
          <img alt="" class="face" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-F67C14BF-CBD8-4FCE-A0A7-B081FC8C55C1_4_5005_c.jpeg" title="cropped-F67C14BF-CBD8-4FCE-A0A7-B081FC8C55C1_4_5005_c.jpeg"/>
          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Prof. Benjamin Hennig
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Benjamin is the local coordinator of ISLANDS in Iceland. He is a geographer interested in social and spatial inequalities, humanity’s impact on the earth, global sustainability and the development of concepts for analysing, visualising and mapping these issues through the use of Geographic Information Systems (GIS), remote sensing and cartographic methods.
           </p>
           <div class="social-icons-group" data-type="group">
            <a data-reiki-hidden="true" href="#" rel="noopener" target="_self">
             <i class="fa icon fa-facebook-square gray">
             </i>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Welcome to Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Gran Canaria, Spain. Nestled in this vibrant city is the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (ULPGC), established in 1989 and spanning six campuses (four in Gran Canaria, one in Lanzarote, and one in Fuerteventura). With over 22,000 students and approximately 1,500 lecturers, the ULPGC is not only a local educational cornerstone but also boasts a diverse community with a significant number of international students.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-01-15-at-14.47.05.jpeg" title="WhatsApp Image 2024-01-15 at 14.47.05"/>

      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          At the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria you will be able to further develop your research skills with a focus on socio-ecological aspects of coastal exploitation on islands. The courses that you will attend are listed below.
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-C1F29DD2-424B-4ABA-AEFD-3737D7D46D93.jpeg" title="cropped-C1F29DD2-424B-4ABA-AEFD-3737D7D46D93.jpeg"/>

      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          <span class="" style="margin-bottom: 2rem; outline-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); outline-style: solid; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; font-size: 3.5rem; line-height: 3.5rem; word-wrap: break-word;">
           Staff at the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria involved in the ISLANDS programme
          </span>
         </h2>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols content-center-sm" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-sm-6 col-md-3">
         <div class="card y-move no-padding bordered">
          <img alt="" class="face" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-RRiera_pic.jpg" title="cropped-RRiera_pic.jpg"/>
          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Dr. Rodrigo Riera
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Dr. Rodrigo Riera is the local coordinator of ISLANDS in Gran Canaria. His research focuses on human-driven perturbations in coastal assemblages, habitat fragmentation and edge effects, and more recently, the impacts of climate change on the ocean.
           </p>
           <div class="social-icons-group" data-type="group">

          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Prof. Ricardo J. Haroun Tabraue
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Prof. Ricardo J. Haroun Tabraue works within biodiversity, ecological processes and sustainable use of marine resources. His expertise is mainly associated with coastal and marine species and habitats in diverse geographical settings.
           </p>
           <div class="social-icons-group" data-type="group">

          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Dr. Fernando Tuya
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Dr. Fernando Tuya is the Head of the BIOCON-ECOAQUA research group. His research is motivated by the necessity of searching for models that aim to explain patterns in the organization of benthic marine assemblages through ecosystems across different scales of space, time and taxonomy.
           </p>
           <div class="social-icons-group" data-type="group">

          <div class="col-padding-small col-padding-small-xs description-container" data-type="column">
           <h4 class="font-500">
            Dr. Francisco Otero Ferrer
           </h4>
           <p class="small" style="font-style: italic;">
            Dr. Francisco Otero Ferrer works within aquaculture, marine biodiversity, technical diving and public aquariums across various European countries. His current research focuses on the functioning of different ‘ecosystems engineers’.

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {

                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;

                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
