  <div class="site" id="page">
   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Groningen, the Netherlands
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--9" data-label="Groningen, the Netherlands" id="groningen" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Geographically, Groningen is rooted in the northern region of the Netherlands. While it is an old city with roots that can be traced back to the Iron Age, population-wise it’s one of the youngest in Europe; the high student population in Groningen brings the average age of the town down to 36. Groningen is a lively student-city with around 50,000 (international) students. It’s no wonder then that the city’s slogan is “Nothing tops Groningen” (in Dutch: “Er gaat niets boven Groningen”).
          <br/>
          During your time in Groningen, you’ll get to experience everything the city has to offer, from a vibrant art and music scene to a unique, student-inspired nightlife. The city itself has everything you need, from open-air street markets to popular fashion chains. There’s also a lot to explore outside the centre: stroll along the canals, visit the iconic coloured houses at Reitdiephaven or challenge yourself by climbing Europe’s tallest freestanding climbing wall.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/tower-5797800_1280.jpg" title="tower-5797800_1280"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--8" data-label="Campus Life" id="campus-life" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-01-15-at-15.15.33.jpeg" title="WhatsApp Image 2024-01-15 at 15.15.33"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Campus Life
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The university buildings are situated all around Groningen and the city’s surroundings. The 11 faculties are based in 150 different buildings around the city. As an ISLANDS student, you will be receiving classes at the Zernike Campus. This campus originated in the late 1960s of the last century on the northern edge of the city of Groningen. An intensive ecosystem was created for public-private cooperation with knowledge institutions, numerous companies and facilities such as Innolab Chemie Groningen, Zernike NanoLab Groningen, Energy Transition Center EnTrance, Energy Academy Europe, Cube050 incubator and the Zernike Advanced Processing facility. This gives the location Zernike Campus an increasingly clear profile focusing on energy, chemistry, life sciences and big data.
          <br/>
          Daily thousands of students, entrepreneurs and researchers visit the campus. That’s why more and more shops are located at the campus, resulting in various places to buy food and drinks, as well as eat.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--11" data-label="Budget" id="budget" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Budget
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Your general daily expenses include food, books, clothes, public transportation, and leisurely activities. You will also need to take into consideration the costs of housing and insurance.
          <br/>
          However, experience shows that students will spend on average €800-1.000 per month, not including tuition costs. The estimate below does not include unforeseen costs and should be used as a general indication of the costs of living in the Netherlands.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          You can find
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/education/master/international-students/financial-matters/living-expenses?lang=en" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/education/master/international-students/financial-matters/living-expenses?lang=en" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           a full overview of average costs of living
          </a>
          on the RUG website.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--10" data-label="Accommodation" id="accommodation" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs content-left-sm" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/city-3956809_1280.jpg" title="city-3956809_1280"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6 content-left-sm" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Accommodation
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Finding somewhere to live can be daunting, especially if you are moving to the Netherlands for the first time. Around 10,000 students will all be looking for a room at the same time in Groningen, so start your search as soon as possible. It is your own responsibility to find a place to live. The University of Groningen does NOT provide accommodation for students.
          <br/>
          Through the housing organisation SSH (Short Stay Housing), a limited amount of temporary housing has been made available for international double degree students. For more information, please visit the housing platform At Home in Groningen. Further housing opportunities can still be found via the Roomfinder.
          <br/>
          You can find more information and tips on how to find accommodation on
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/education/master/international-students/study-in-the-netherlands-groningen/accommodation" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/education/master/international-students/study-in-the-netherlands-groningen/accommodation" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           the dedicated RUG-webpage on accommodation
          </a>
          .
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--12" data-label="Leisure Activities" id="leisure-activities" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Leisure Activities
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          While its history can be traced back to 300 BC, today Groningen is a vibrant student city with the youngest population in the Netherlands – one in four people here is a student! That means there’s always something to do, with various art and music festivals, theatres, cinemas and performance venues catering to all tastes, whether you prefer to watch or want to join in. The Groninger Museum with its world-renowned contemporary art exhibitions and the 133-year old Stadsschouwburg, one of the oldest and best-looking city theatres in the Netherlands, are must-visits, too.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Many students are active in student associations outside of their studies. Groningen has something for everyone, ranging from sports associations to political-, cultural- and study associations. These student associations are a lot of fun and give you experiences you’ll remember your entire life.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/groningen-1452259_1280.jpg" title="groningen-1452259_1280"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--13" data-label="Public Transport" id="public-transport" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-01-15-at-15.11.15.jpeg" title="WhatsApp Image 2024-01-15 at 15.11.15"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Public Transport
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Groningen has a compact city centre, making it easy to get around on foot, by bicycle or via public transportation. Recently named the “biking capital of the world” it’s no surprise that Groningen has a fantastic biking infrastructure, everything is just a short bike ride away.
          <br/>
          The Netherlands has a very efficient and reliable public transportation system, but you are advised to purchase a public transport pass (OV-chipkaart) to take the best advantage of it. You can apply for a public transport pass via the OV-chipkaart home-page. It is possible to upload credit on the card and use it to check in and out of the various public transport systems without having to buy tickets each time. Just remember that you must always check in and out every time you get on or off a bus, train, metro or tram. The 9292 app is very useful when planning a trip, as it takes all the different transportation companies you can use into account.
         </p>
         <a class="button color1" href="#">
          LEARN MORE
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--15" data-label="Language Courses" id="language-courses" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Language Courses
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Are you worried about language differences? The Netherlands ranks 2nd in the 2018 EF English Proficiency Index; most Dutch citizens can switch almost effortlessly from Dutch to English and will do so when they notice you’re an international who doesn’t speak Dutch. But if you would like to learn a new language or improve your language skills for study, work, or simply because you enjoy it,
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/language-centre/language-courses/?lang=en" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/language-centre/language-courses?lang=en" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           The University of Groningen Language Center
          </a>
          offers courses in a range of languages to students.
          <br/>
          The Language Centre also offers Dutch language courses at various levels and for various target groups. Thanks to the teaching methods developed by their teachers, you will learn Dutch very quickly.
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/language-centre/language-courses/dutch/" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/language-centre/language-courses/dutch" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           The Dutch courses
          </a>
          begin at multiple different times throughout the year.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-01-15-at-15.12.13-1.jpeg" title="WhatsApp Image 2024-01-15 at 15.12.13"/>
        </div>
       </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
    
    
/* ]]> */

  <div class="site" id="page">
   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--8" data-label="I" id="intro" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Welcome to Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, the capital of the island of Gran Canaria, one of the islands of the heavenly Canary archipelago. It is the most cosmopolitan city of the Canary Islands and its privileged geographical location also makes it the European capital of the mid-Atlantic and a cultural and economic bridge between Europe, Africa and America. A city with a population ca. 380,000 inhabitants, and also home of the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (ULPGC).
          <br/>
          The city of Las Palmas is where most cultural events take place in Gran Canaria. It is host to a number of festivals, celebrations, and concerts annually. Every year, it organizes the Canary Islands Music Festival and the International Film Festival. Las Palmas and its surrounding municipalities also have several museums to offer, including the Museo Canario which has a large collection of historical objects available to the public. There is also a lovely theater (Teatro Pérez Galdós), and a museum dedicated to Canarian artist Néstor Martín-Fernández de la Torre. In addition, residents celebrate their annual Carnaval, one of the most popular events in Spain. The festivities include the gala of drag queens, a street parade, and live music.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/gran-canaria-4860130_1280.jpg" title="gran-canaria-4860130_1280"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--2" data-label="University Campus" id="university-campus" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/gran-canaria-4360002_1280.jpg" title="gran-canaria-4360002_1280"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          University Campus
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The Faculty of Marine Sciences, in which the courses take place, is located in the campus in Tafira, an area in the surroundings of the city (Las Palmas de Gran Canaria). This campus has several faculties, leisure areas, breathtaking views of the city and the east coast of the island. Transportation is cheap and well connected with several bus lines. Numerous bars, restaurants and canteen are in the campus of Tafira with affordable menus.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--3" data-label="Budget" id="budget" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Budget
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Living on Gran Canaria as a student is not very expensive, groceries as well as restaurants and bars are affordable. If you have a moderate lifestyle, living costs can be approximately 350-450€ per month in food. Accommodation is relatively affordable if you avoid touristic areas of the city of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, such as the La Minilla or the Siete Palmas neighbourhoods that are adjacent and well-connected to Tafira campus. For accommodation we encourage the students to check out the web sites below to get the most updated overview of the rent range.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
         </p>
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/gran-canaria-1127878_1280.jpg" title="gran-canaria-1127878_1280"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--4" data-label="Accommodation" id="accommodation" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dunes-1646099_1280.jpg" title="dunes-1646099_1280"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Accommodation
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria does not provide accommodation for its incoming students. However, there are various sites that can help you find accommodation.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--5" data-label="Leisure Activities" id="leisure-activities" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Leisure Activities
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          There are countless ways of exploring the Island! A wide selection of activities are available for students, see below some examples that might be of your interest if you are up for exploring the attractions of this magnificent island.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Follow the link for examples of
          <a data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.getyourguide.co.uk/gran-canaria-l418/?visitor-id=EEDHWL9KFZ6KK0VPNG%20LCA4VTHLBZS1YX&locale_autoredirect_optout=true" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.getyourguide.co.uk/gran-canaria-l418/?visitor-id=EEDHWL9KFZ6KK0VPNG%20LCA4VTHLBZS1YX&locale_autoredirect_optout=true" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           things to do in Gran Canaria
          </a>
          :
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/beach-5847003_1280.jpg" title="beach-5847003_1280"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--6" data-label="Public Transport" id="public-transport" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/cropped-LasPalmas-scaled-1.jpg" title="cropped-LasPalmas-scaled-1.jpg"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Public Transport
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          There are several buses to get to Tafira campus.  Public transport is affordable, and several options (bonos) are available for students, including special offers if you show your student ID.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--7" data-label="Language Courses" id="language-courses" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Language Courses
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          If you want to learn Spanish to help you with everyday communication situations, you have a 3-week intensive course during a Summer school, check out
          <a data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://internacional.ulpgc.es/en/idiomas-summer/.%20Check for other possibilities in the web of internationalization of our University https://internacional.ulpgc.es/en" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://internacional.ulpgc.es/en/idiomas-summer/.%20Check for other possibilities in the web of internationalization of our University https://internacional.ulpgc.es/en" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           this link
          </a>
          !
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/0484e9bf-9aeb-4c7b-ac08-6d3bf1e36482.jpg" title="0484e9bf-9aeb-4c7b-ac08-6d3bf1e36482"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Mytilene, Greece
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--1" data-label="Intro" id="intro" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          ISLANDS students attend the University of the Aegean Campus, located in the capital of Lesvos, Mytilene. The town of Mytilene is full of life, being a growing city with 30,000 inhabitants. The town is built on small hills, on top of the ruins of an ancient city. The prosperous economic past of the town is reflected in impressive mansions, while the establishment of the University of the Aegean has given it free rein and has livened things up.
          <br/>
          Lesvos is the third biggest island of Greece, with 1,632 square kilometres in extent and 86,436 inhabitants. The immense areas of olive groves, pine forests, oaks, the rich gulfs of Gera and Kalloni, and the impressive Petrified Forest of Lesvos (at Sigri) compose a multifarious and particularly attractive natural landscape. Lesvos is renowned for its rich history and culture, depicted in numerous archaeological and historical monuments and works of art. The homeland of ancient Greek poets such as Sappho, Alceus, and Theofrastus, as well as modern Greek painters like Theofilos and modern Greek writers such as Myrivilis, Eftaliotieses, and Elytis (Nobel Prize for Poetry in 1979), Lesvos is famous for its rich culture and contribution to world literature and arts.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2023-11-25-at-09.20.30.png" title="WhatsApp Image 2023-11-25 at 09.20.30"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--2" data-label="University Campus" id="university-campus" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/lesvos.png" title="lesvos"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          University Campus
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The campus is located on University Hill, with a beautiful view over the city of Mytilene. Here you will find the School of Social Sciences, and the School of Environment. The canteen and a café is also located on campus.
          <br/>
          In the first couple of days, you’ll receive your UAegean student ID card that gives you free transportation to and from the university campus with the School Bus, and access to the University Canteen.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Life in the town of Mytilene combines the advantages of a small scale place and a place with a long history and tradition. Cultural events, sports activities, musical events and performances at the town and the University, along with the vibrant nightlife in the bars of the harbor and the traditional food, snacks and ouzo at the taverns.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--3" data-label="Budget" id="budget" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Budget
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Living on Lesvos as a student can be inexpensive if you are considered. Eating out is relatively cheap, and groceries are mostly inexpensive. Thus, living costs can be kept at a low rate if you are regularly eating in the University canteen, mostly cook yourself and are occasionally eating out.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Cost of living is approximately 300€ to 500€ per month (excluding accommodation). Furthermore, taxis are relatively cheap (expect around 6-7€ per urban ride), and buses to the University are free.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--4" data-label="Accommodation" id="accommodation" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/IMG_0220.png" title="IMG_0220"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Accommodation
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The University of the Aegean does not provide accommodation for its incoming students. However, there are various sites that can help you find accommodation. Finding accommodation in Mytilene is usually not a challenge, but we still recommend you to start looking early.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--5" data-label="Leisure Activities" id="leisure-activities" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Leisure Activities
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          You will never be bored living on Lesvos! Leisure activities possible on Lesvos include scuba diving, sailing and other water sports, trecking through the captivating nature, and enjoying the many beautiful beaches on the islands. The University also has a gym that can be used for free. You will never get bored on Lesvos!
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/WhatsApp-Image-2023-11-25-at-09.44.35.png" title="WhatsApp Image 2023-11-25 at 09.44.35"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--6" data-label="Public Transport" id="public-transport" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Kolade-9.png" title="Kolade 9"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Public Transport
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          There is a School Bus going from the city centre to University Hill every weekday. It leaves from Sappho Square every 30 minutes going to the University Campus. With your student ID identifying you as a student at the University of the Aegean the School Bus is free of charge.
          <br/>
          There is also public transport that can take you around the city of Mytilene and Lesvos island.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--9" data-label="Language Courses" id="language-courses" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Language Courses
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          If you want to learn basic Greek to help you with everyday communication situations please express your interest to us.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Minh-4.jpeg" title="Minh 4"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

   <div class="header-wrapper">
    <div class="header color-overlay custom-mobile-image" data-parallax-depth="20" style='; background-image:url("https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Texel_header.jpg"); background-color:#FFFFFF'>
     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Reykjavík, Iceland
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>
      if (window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing) {
			window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing();
		}
     </script>
     <div class="split-header">
     </div>

   </div>
   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--7" data-label="Reykjavík, Iceland" id="intro" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Welcome to Reykjavík, the northernmost capital city of a sovereign state and the smallest big city in the world. With a population of over 130,000 and over 230,000 people in the larger Capital region, almost ¾ of Iceland’s population live in and around Reykjavík.
          <br/>
          Iceland is often referred to as a land of fire and ice which one can witness in its extraordinary nature. Europe’s most sparsely populated and second largest island offers unique insights into the relationship between humans and their natural environment. Living just below the Arctic Circle and on top of an active volcanic zone requires its people to live with the extremes that nature throws at them. This is reflected in the Icelandic mindset, where the phrase þetta reddast (“it will all work out okay”) is more than a saying, but the country’s unofficial motto and a way of life. Icelanders always maintain the firm belief that everything will be fine in the end, no matter how big the problems may be.
          <br/>
          In this spirit, whatever Iceland may throw at you, don’t forget: þetta reddast!
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-IMG_0746.png" title="cropped-IMG_0746.png"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--2" data-label="University Campus" id="university-campus" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/511B0922-2381-419E-89EB-D92D9470CB9F.jpeg" title="511B0922-2381-419E-89EB-D92D9470CB9F"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          University Campus
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The campus is located conveniently within walking distance from the city centre of Reykjavík. It is served by several public bus lines and near the BSÍ bus terminal that operates one of the privately run airport buses.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Reykjavík is a city to recharge, restore and refuel. It’s a city surrounded by incredible nature – but at the same time, a city full of life. Life in Reykjavík combines the advantages of a small place while also being a capital city and most important urban area in the country. Stunning nature and the sea are never far away, while Reykjavík hosts major cultural events, sports activities, musical events and performances, along with a vibrant nightlife in the pubs and bars.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--3" data-label="Budget" id="budget" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Budget
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          It is important to keep in mind that Iceland is expensive, and if you are planning to study in Reykjavík you have to consider your budget for living expenses.
          <br/>
          The minimum support criteria for an individual living in Reykjavík is ISK 212,694 per month (approx. EUR 1,400.00) according to the Welfare Division of Reykjavík City.
          <br/>
          However, this amount does not necessarily reflect actual living costs, which can vary greatly depending on your lifestyle and spending habits.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <p class="">
          Rough estimates of living costs for a single person:
          <br/>
          – Housing, including utilities: typically ISK 100,000/month.
          <br/>
          – Food and daily expenses: ISK 50,000/month.
          <br/>
          – Books and other study materials: ISK 40,000/semester.
          <br/>
          – Local public transportation: ISK 6,000/month.
          <br/>
          – Leisure activities: ISK 30,000/month.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--4" data-label="Accommodation" id="accommodation" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/image00007.jpeg" title="image00007"/>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Accommodation
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The University of Iceland does not provide or guarantee housing for students. The supply of on-campus housing is limited and students often live off-campus. Reykjavík is an expensive city and monthly rent for an individual is typically from 100,000 ISK (approx 725 EUR) and up. Due to the high demand for student housing in Reykjavík, finding a room or apartment on your own can take up some time and effort. It is important to take this into consideration and start your search early. You may also want to consider looking together with fellow ISLANDS students for shared accommodation.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--5" data-label="Leisure Activities" id="leisure-activities" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Leisure Activities
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          Studying at a university involves more than attending lectures and completing assignments. The University of Iceland is conscious that social life is also an important part of university life. An overview of leisure activities offered through university organisations
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://english.hi.is/university/student_life" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://english.hi.is/university/student_life" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           is presented here
          </a>
          .
          <br/>
          <br/>
          In the dark and short winter days you may be rewarded with stunning displays of the northern lights, and will come to love the neverending light as mid-summer approaches.
          <br/>
          There are few things better for mental, physical, and social health than the outdoors and exercise. The plentiful outdoor pools are a perfect place for that, whatever the weather—and soaking in the hot tub is beyond compare not only during a snowstorm! The city of Reykjavík alone has eight public pools (called Sundlaug), and the rest of the country plenty more even in the remotest towns.
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/cropped-579DDAAA-675D-46C5-B0AA-601EFA035544.jpeg" title="cropped-579DDAAA-675D-46C5-B0AA-601EFA035544.jpeg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-8 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-8" data-id="content--6" data-label="Public Transport" id="public-transport" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs space-top-xs" data-type="column">
         <a class="" data-cp-link="1" href="#" rel="noopener" target="_self">
          <img class="custom-image" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/011DF20C-9DC2-41DF-BA21-BD83014FCD4D.jpeg"/>
         </a>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Public Transport
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          The University is very conveniently located for public transport and many bus routes have stops close to a number of University buildings. The Icelandic word strætó means ‘bus’. It is, furthermore, easy to get around on foot or by bike.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-7 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-7" data-id="content--8" data-label="Language Courses" id="language-courses" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row middle-sm">
        <div class="col-sm-6 space-bottom-xs" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Language Courses
         </h2>
         <p class="">
          If you want to learn basic Icelandic to help you with everyday communication situations, you can use the free Icelandic Online courses offered by the University of Iceland. The University now offers six online Icelandic courses based on sound second language acquisition research and innovative instructional practice combined with the relevant technology. The goal is to provide an interesting, entertaining and effective online language learning environment. Icelandic Online allows anyone with Internet access the possibility of participating for free in
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://icelandiconline.com/" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://icelandiconline.com" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           a global community of learners of Icelandic.
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6" data-type="column">
         <img alt="" class="shadow-large" decoding="async" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/4056C3AC-2DC7-4692-8FB4-13652002C49E.jpeg" title="4056C3AC-2DC7-4692-8FB4-13652002C49E"/>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();

     <div class="inner-header-description gridContainer">
      <div class="row header-description-row">
       <div class="col-xs col-xs-12">
        <h1 class="hero-title">
         Programme Introduction
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <script>

   <div class="page-content no-padding">
    <div class="content">
     <div class="features-13 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-13" data-id="features--1" data-label="Intro" id="intro" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: center;">
          Welcome to the ISLANDS programme, a dynamic 2-year Research Master that delves into the fascinating intersection of Islands and Sustainability with a curriculum entirely taught in English.
Our program is tailored to provide a comprehensive blend of research and professional skills spanning spatial, social, and environmental sciences. Gain a systematic understanding of scientific theories that spotlight islands as distinctive and crucial places, all while exploring the natural and human-induced processes shaping their rich history, present, and future. Elevate your academic journey with ISLANDS, where local knowledge meets global perspectives.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col col-sm-6 col-md-3 space-bottom">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--1" data-label="Content" id="themes" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          Islands focuses on two main themes
         </h2>
         <p class="lead">
          Understanding the distinct characteristics of islands, their socio-economical, geopolitical, and environmental impacts, and the development of policies tailored to address their specific challenges.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          Developing tools, skills, and technology to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical sustainability applications.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row center-xs middle-xs">
        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="features-12-card-bordered-colored content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12-card-bordered-colored" data-id="features--3" data-label="Skills" id="skills" style="background-color: rgb(240, 247, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead">
          Students not only expand their knowledge, but also cultivate critical thinking and research abilities, enabling them to:
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             <span style="font-weight: 300;">
              Analyse environmental issues and establish holistic perspectives on their relationship with human activities on islands
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Navigate diverse information resources, delivering effective presentations, collaborating in multidisciplinary teams, and communicating professionally in English
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Evaluate environmental policies within various island contexts
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Create and assess environmental protection strategies for both private and public island organisations
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-check bordered round small color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <br/>
             Evaluate development projects, plans, policies, and technologies from spatial, economical, legal, cultural, marketing, and environmental standpoints
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="features-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="features" data-export-id="features-12" data-id="features--2" data-label="Structure" id="structure" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); background-image: none;">
      <div class="">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <p class="lead">
          For an overview of the programme structure and courses offered in the programme, see our dedicated page on the programme structure.
         </p>
         <a class="button color2" data-cp-link="1" data-icon="fa-reorder" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/programme-introduction/programme-structure" rel="noopener" target="_self">
          <span class="button-icon fa fa-reorder">
          </span>
          Programme Structure
         </a>
         <p class="lead">
          Information about the application process and the application requirements are shown on our application form page.
         </p>
         <a class="button color2" data-cp-link="1" data-icon="fa-pencil" href="https://islandsmaster.eu/application-form" rel="noopener" target="_self">
          <span class="button-icon fa fa-pencil">
          </span>
          Apply here
         </a>
         <p class="">
          <br/>
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 400;">
           <span style="font-weight: 500;">
            Studying with special educational needs
           </span>
           <br/>
           <br/>
           <span style="font-weight: 300;">
            All partner universities in the ISLANDS programme offer support for students with special needs. Further information can be found on the website of each partner university, linked below, or by sending us an email.
           </span>
          </span>
          <br/>
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/education/student-service-centre/bijzondere-omstandigheden/studying-with-special-needs/?lang=en" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/education/student-service-centre/bijzondere-omstandigheden/studying-with-special-needs?lang=en" rel="noopener" target="_self">

          </a>
          –
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.aegean.edu/teaching-and-learning-support-office/" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.aegean.edu/teaching-and-learning-support-office" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           University of the Aegean
          </a>
          –
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.ulpgc.es/accion-social/atencionaestudiantescondi" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.ulpgc.es/accion-social/atencionaestudiantescondi" rel="noopener" target="_self">
           University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
          </a>
          –
          <a class="" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://english.hi.is/student_counselling_centre" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://english.hi.is/student_counselling_centre" rel="noopener" target="_self">

             ﻿
            </span>
           </span>

     <div class="content-12 content-section content-section-spacing" data-category="content" data-export-id="content-12" data-id="content--2" data-label="After your Studies" id="after-your-studies" style="background-color: rgb(245, 250, 253); background-image: none;">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row text-center">
        <div class="section-title-col" data-type="column">
         <h2 class="">
          After Your Studies
         </h2>
         <p class="lead">
          Whether your passion lies in academia, research, policy development, or consultancy, the skills honed during your time in the programme will open doors to a myriad of opportunities. Graduates of the ISLANDS programme are well-equipped to contribute to cutting-edge research, shape sustainable policies, or provide valuable insights as consultants in the dynamic intersection of islands and sustainability. The possibilities are as vast as the ocean itself, offering a platform for you to make a meaningful impact in the professional landscape of your choosing. Your journey doesn’t conclude with the ISLANDS program; it sets the stage for a future where your expertise and insights are invaluable.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>

        <div class="col-sm-9" data-type="column">
        </div>
       </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
    
    
/* ]]> */

          <span style="text-align: left;">

          </span>
          All applicants are required to submit the following documents to the Admissions Office:

              Bachelor’s diploma/A document indicating the name of your qualification in the original language (and if applicable, Master’s diploma)
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-file-text-o bordered round color2">

           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">

             <br/>
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              List of grades/transcript of records of your Bachelor’s degree (and if applicable, Master’s degree)
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-12">
         <div class="card row-card bottom-border-color2">

            <i class="fa icon fa-file-text bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              Motivation letter (max two pages), which should include:
             </span>
             <br/>
             A clear expression of your interest in studying Islands and Sustainability.
             <br/>
             A demonstration of your drives and enthusiasm to become a researcher in this field.
             <br/>
             An explanation of your reasons for choosing one of our island universities for your compulsory mobility periods where you wish to spend your two mobility periods as part of your programme.
             <br/>
             Please address why you are the most suitable candidate and how the programme connects to your past and your future ambitions.
            </p>

          </div>

            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <p class="">
             <span style="font-weight: 500;">
              Use of Generative AI in applications
             </span>
             <br/>
             As part of the ISLANDS Master’s programme, we value authenticity, honesty, and the unique perspectives that each applicant brings. While we recognise the role of AI in today’s world, we encourage applicants to focus on conveying their genuine motivations and personal experiences in their applications. By crafting original and thoughtful letters, you help us gain a clear and meaningful understanding of your aspirations and your fit for our programme. If you choose to use AI tools as part of your process, please be open about it – transparency is an important part of our admissions process.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>

          </span>
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 500;">
           Scholarship
          </span>
          applications are open from
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           November 1st
          </span>
          until the application deadline on
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           January 15th
          </span>
          for the upcoming autumn semester. Interviews for shortlisted applicants will be conducted in February and March.
          <br/>
          <span style="font-weight: 500;">
           Self-funded
          </span>
          candidates can apply until
          <span style="font-weight: 700;">
           April 1st
          </span>
          each year, with the intention to start in the autumn semester of the same year. Interviews for these candidates may be held in April and May.

            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {

            }

   <div class="content post-page" id="page-content">
    <div class="gridContainer">
     <div class="row">
      <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-8 col-md-9">
       <div class="post-item">
        <div class="post-1932 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-blog category-students tag-34 tag-award tag-hackathon tag-iceland tag-students" id="post-1932">
         <div class="post-content-single">
          <h2 class="h1">
           From Iceland with Kelp: ISLANDS students win the 2025 Copernicus Hackathon
          </h2>
          <div class="post-meta muted">
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-user">
           </i>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/author/islands-admin/" rel="author" title="Posts by ISLANDS MSc">
            ISLANDS MSc
           </a>
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-folder-o">
           </i>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/blog/" rel="category tag">
            Blog
           </a>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/blog/students/" rel="category tag">
            Students
           </a>
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-calendar">
           </i>
           <span class="post-date">
            27 February 2025
           </span>
           |
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-comment-o">
           </i>
           <span>
            0
           </span>
          </div>
          <div class="post-content-inner">
           <img alt="" class="space-bottom-small space-bottom-xs wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="469" sizes="(max-width: 452px) 100vw, 452px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Winners.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Winners.jpg 452w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Winners-289x300.jpg 289w" width="452"/>
           <p>
            In the ISLANDs Masters’ first weekend of their mobility at the University of Iceland, Aya, Aisling, Jacqueline and associate islander Christian were awarded first place for the Copernicus Ocean Hackathon 2025. The top prize was awarded to our team of islands students for their project, called Kelpture, specializing in the emerging industry of kelp farming site optimization. The Hackathon took place over two and a half days during the weekend (Feb 07 – 09), in which our team of island students competed with seven other teams of students and industry experts to brainstorm, develop and pitch sustainable solutions and help Icelandic companies and authorities monitor the ocean and coastal habitats. The event was hosted by Reykjavik University and was run in collaboration with Startup Iceland and Náttúrufræðistofnun (Natural Science Institute of Iceland) with the goal of transforming satellite data into value for the blue economy.Day one of the Hackathon included a talk from Bala Kamallakharan, the founder of Startup Iceland and Iceland Venture Studio, to get the teams thinking about an initial idea to tackle one of four potential ocean related themes, along with (free!) pizza. During the event, presentations were also given by multiple experts in the Blue Economy, notably Angel Luiz a professor from the University of Iceland on the Power of the Ocean and Sveinn Sigurður Jóhannesson, the CEO of GreenFish – a  company specializing in efficiency within the fishing industry.
           </p>
           <p>
            On day two of the event, the team began brainstorming ideas. The Kelpture team chose Climate Change & Rising Sea Levels as their selected theme, to address ecosystem disruption, oceanic heat absorption and ocean acidification caused by Climate Change. The team were also given the opportunity to be mentored by Natural Science specialist Marco Pizzolato who provided advice for the upcoming project pitch the following day.
           </p>
           <p>
            On the final day all eight teams finalised the project and prepared their pitches which were to be presented to a panel of ocean economy experts. The islands students’ project, Kelpture, explored an AI-powered Kelp farming site selection tool that assists farmers with finding optimal locations for kelp harvesting around Iceland. Kelp farming in particular was specifically chosen as studies have shown that this type of macroalgae, is considered a high-impact carbon capturer, and thus a viable solution which tackles ocean-related climate issues and contributes to multiple UN Sustainable Development Goals. This innovative tool was created using various publicly available data sources including Copernicus
            <a data-id="https://data.marine.copernicus.eu/products" data-type="link" href="https://data.marine.copernicus.eu/products" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             Marine Data
            </a>
            and
            <a data-id="https://www.coastal.hub.copernicus.eu" data-type="link" href="https://www.coastal.hub.copernicus.eu" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             Coastal Hub
            </a>
            . This data was used for multiple analyses to determine ocean locations which are optimal for kelp growth (as shown in the map below).
           </p>
           <div class="wp-block-image">
            <figure class="aligncenter size-full is-resized">
             <img alt="Icelandic Kelp Optimized Sites" class="wp-image-1933" decoding="async" height="328" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 624px) 100vw, 624px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Kelpture.png" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Kelpture.png 624w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Kelpture-300x158.png 300w" style="width:624px;height:auto" width="624"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <p>
            The Kelpture team, along with all the other teams, then presented their pitches to the panel of judges, consisting of Alexandra Leeper, the CEO of Icelandic Ocean Cluster, Marco Pizzolato, Specialist at the Natural Science Institute of Iceland and CTO at Fléttan, and Sveinn Sigurður Jóhannesson, Co-Founder and CEO of GreenFish. The teams were then judged by strict criteria, including the quality of the presentation, effective use of satellite data, solution alignment with the hackathon’s goals, innovation, feasibility, and the range of skill sets offered by the members of each team.
           </p>
           <div class="wp-block-image">
            <figure class="aligncenter size-full">
             <img alt="Final Presentation of Kelpture" class="wp-image-1934" decoding="async" height="415" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 780px) 100vw, 780px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Presentation.png" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Presentation.png 780w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Presentation-300x160.png 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Presentation-768x409.png 768w" width="780"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <p>
            For the team’s research output and the pitch, presented by Aya Youssef, the Kelpture team – out of the top three prizes – was awarded the top prize of 100.000 ISK cash prize. Additionally for their work and the opportunity for the team to develop this project further, access was also awarded to the team to the Iceland Ocean Cluster (IOC) innovation space valued at 49.000 ISK.
           </p>
           <p>
            Additional details about the hackathon, as well as recordings of the presentations which took place at the Hackathon, and the prize ceremony can be found in the following links:
           </p>
           <ul class="wp-block-list">
            <li>
             Copernicus Ocean Hackathon 2025:
             <a href="https://sjavarklasinn.is/en/copernicus-hackathon-2/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              https://sjavarklasinn.is/en/copernicus-hackathon-2/
             </a>
            </li>
            <li>
             Final Project Presentations:
             <a href="https://www.youtube.com/live/2uqrgRsBxxQ?si=ja8X155UmRVJfCmn&t=529" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              https://www.youtube.com/live/2uqrgRsBxxQ?si=ja8X155UmRVJfCmn&t=529
             </a>
            </li>
            <li>
             Prize Ceremony:
             <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3grvKVmnCfQ" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3grvKVmnCfQ
             </a>
            </li>
           </ul>
           <div class="wp-block-image">
            <figure class="aligncenter size-full">
             <img alt="The ISLANDS-Iceland Kelpture team" class="wp-image-1935" decoding="async" height="263" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Selfie.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Selfie.jpg 468w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/IcelandHackathon2025Selfie-300x169.jpg 300w" width="468"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <p>
            <em>
             <mark class="has-inline-color has-cyan-bluish-gray-color" style="background-color:rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)">
              A contribution sent in by Aya, Aisling, Jaqueline, and ISLANDS-associate Chris of the 2023 and 2024 intake from the ISLANDS programme.
             </mark>
            </em>
           </p>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
    
    
/* ]]> */
