        <div class="post-1901 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-events category-islas tag-34 tag-iceland tag-islands tag-islas tag-summer-school" id="post-1901">
         <div class="post-content-single">
          <h2 class="h1">
           ISLAs 2025 Summer School in Iceland
          </h2>
          <div class="post-meta muted">
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-user">
           </i>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/author/islands-admin/" rel="author" title="Posts by ISLANDS MSc">
            ISLANDS MSc
           </a>
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-folder-o">
           </i>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/news/events/" rel="category tag">
            Events
           </a>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/islas/" rel="category tag">
            ISLAs
           </a>
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-calendar">
           </i>
           <span class="post-date">
            12 December 2024
           </span>
           |
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-comment-o">
           </i>
           <span>
            0
           </span>
          </div>
          <div class="post-content-inner">
           <img alt="" class="space-bottom-small space-bottom-xs wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="448" sizes="(max-width: 1120px) 100vw, 1120px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1.jpg 1470w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-300x120.jpg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-1024x410.jpg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/SummerSchool2025_isafjordur_UW2-1-768x307.jpg 768w" width="1120"/>
           <h4>
            Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability (ISLAs): Remote Communities in Transition
           </h4>
           <p>
            Methodologically and scientifically, islands serve as ideal ‘laboratories’ for examining the intricate interplay of environmental, social, and economic sustainability. Moreover, their isolated nature makes them key sites for exploring how remote communities adapt to the pressures of modern transitions, from environmental changes to socio-economic shifts.
            <br/>
            Co-organised by the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Islands and Sustainability (ISLANDS), the University Centre of the Westfjords, and the University of Iceland, the ISLAs Summer School 2025 will take place in person in the Westfjords of Iceland from June 28th to July 6th 2025.
            <br/>
            <span id="more-1901">
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="https://www.rug.nl/education/summer-winter-schools/islands-and-sustainability/">
             <img alt="" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-1905" decoding="async" height="1024" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 724px) 100vw, 724px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ISLAs-2025-Iceland-724x1024.png" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ISLAs-2025-Iceland-724x1024.png 724w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ISLAs-2025-Iceland-212x300.png 212w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ISLAs-2025-Iceland-768x1086.png 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ISLAs-2025-Iceland-764x1080.png 764w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ISLAs-2025-Iceland.png 827w" width="724"/>
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            During the summer school, participants will explore key topics around the transitions faced by remote island communities, with a focus on socio-economic adaptations, environmental sustainability, and cultural resilience. The Westfjords region of Iceland, with its striking natural beauty, sparse population, and history of remote community life, provides a compelling backdrop for this summer school. Participants will study these concepts academically and experience firsthand the realities of communities in transition. This immersive experience will deepen their understanding of sustainability, resilience, and the cultural challenges of remote living.
            <br/>
            The main teaching activities will take place in the University Centre of the Westfjords in the town on Isafjörður, with excursions to local villages and natural sites. This provides a unique combination of academic engagement and real-world application, giving participants insights into the complex issues surrounding sustainability and resilience in remote island communities.
            <br/>
            The main part of the ISLAs Summer School 2025 will take place from Saturday, June 28th to Sunday, July 6th starting in Reykjavík, the capital city of Iceland. The programme will also include a series of preparatory virtual tasks and meetings in June, and will formally conclude with the submission of a report due at the end of July.
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Application Deadline: 23 February 2025
            </strong>
            <br/>
            <em>
             (rolling admission, spaces are limited to 20 participants)
            </em>
           </p>
           <p>
            More information and application form:
            <br/>
            <a href="https://www.rug.nl/education/summer-winter-schools/islands-and-sustainability/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
             Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability Summer School 2025
            </a>
           </p>

           </a>
          </p>

   <div class="content post-page" id="page-content">
    <div class="gridContainer">
     <div class="row">
      <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-8 col-md-9">
       <div class="post-item">
        <div class="post-1825 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-blog category-islas category-students tag-28 tag-islands tag-islas tag-studies tag-summer-school" id="post-1825">
         <div class="post-content-single">
          <h2 class="h1">
           Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability (ISLAs) Summer School 2024
          </h2>
          <div class="post-meta muted">
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-user">
           </i>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/author/islands-admin/" rel="author" title="Posts by ISLANDS MSc">
            ISLANDS MSc
           </a>
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-folder-o">
           </i>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/blog/" rel="category tag">
            Blog
           </a>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/islas/" rel="category tag">
            ISLAs
           </a>
           <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu/category/blog/students/" rel="category tag">
            Students
           </a>
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-calendar">
           </i>
           <span class="post-date">
            10 July 2024
           </span>
           |
           <i class="font-icon-post fa fa-comment-o">
           </i>
           <span>
            0
           </span>
          </div>
          <div class="post-content-inner">
           <img alt="" class="space-bottom-small space-bottom-xs wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="736" sizes="(max-width: 1120px) 100vw, 1120px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF.jpeg 2330w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF-300x197.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF-1024x673.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF-768x505.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF-1536x1010.jpeg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF-2048x1347.jpeg 2048w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/05CF5A5D-2689-47CA-8947-5EE1EFBD64BF-1643x1080.jpeg 1643w" width="1120"/>
           <p>
            We are excited and happy to share some highlights from the Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability (ISLAs) Summer/Winter School 2024. ISLAs is a yearly summer school initiative by the
            <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu">
             Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Programme ISLANDS
            </a>
            and the University of Groningen, Faculty of Spatial Sciences. This year, ISLAs was co-organised with the Winter School Small Islands Planning organised by
            <a href="https://www.itb.ac.id/">
             Institut Teknologi Bandung
            </a>
            , the local organisers at
            <a href="https://ppb.ac.id/">
             Politeknik Pariwisata Bali
            </a>
            , and
            <a href="https://www.usm.my/">
             Universiti Sains Malaysia
            </a>
            . The school comprised online introductory and fieldwork preparatory sessions on 13-14 June, and on-site meetings and fieldwork on Bali and Nusa Lembongan, Indonesia, between 17-22 June! The theme this year focused on small island planning to enhance quality of life and happiness on islands. This year, the school was enriched with over 80 participants from all over the world and with diverse backgrounds!
           </p>
           <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-1826" decoding="async" height="571" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16-1024x571.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16-1024x571.jpg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16-300x167.jpg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16-768x428.jpg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16-1536x857.jpg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16-1920x1071.jpg 1920w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.16.jpg 1954w" width="1024"/>
           </figure>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text has-media-on-the-right is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              The first online sessions included lectures on topics such as sustainable tourism, marine conservation, and quality of life and happiness on islands, held by our ISLANDS partners, Prof Dimitris Ballas
              <a href="https://www.rug.nl/staff/d.ballas/">
               Dimitris Ballas
              </a>
              from the University of Groningen and director of ISLANDS
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/islandsmaster/">
               ISLANDS MSc
              </a>
              , Dr Frans Sijtsma from the University of Groningen and Director of the
              <a href="https://www.rug.nl/rudolf-agricola-school/">
               Rudolf Agricola School for Sustainable Development
              </a>
              , Prof Thanasis Kizos from University of the Aegean, Prof Benjamin Hennig from University of Iceland, Dr Rodrigo Riera from University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, as well as Dr Dewa Ayu Made Lily Dianasari from Politeknik Pariwisata Bali, and Dr Leela Rajamani and Dr Norlaila Binti Mohd Zanuri from University Sains Malaysia.
             </p>
            </div>
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1827 size-full" decoding="async" height="1024" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 761px) 100vw, 761px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.18-761x1024.jpg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.18-761x1024.jpg 761w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.18-223x300.jpg 223w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.18-768x1033.jpg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Image-10-07-2024-at-19.18.jpg 800w" width="761"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <p>
            On our first day in Bali we visited the traditional village Penglipuran, where we learned about their approach to and philosophy of tourism management from the local representative. After lunch in Kintamani with a breathtaking view of Mount Batu, we travelled south to Melasti beach and experienced the traditional Kecak dance. This day provided an opportunity to gain real-world insights into the themes and topics introduced during the first two online lecture days. It also connected these themes to the Balinese philosophy of life, Tri Hita Karana, which emphasises harmony and balance between the spiritual world, people, and nature as the three sources of well-being and happiness.
           </p>
           <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-1831" decoding="async" height="717" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1-1024x717.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1-1024x717.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1-300x210.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1-768x538.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1-1536x1076.jpeg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1-1541x1080.jpeg 1541w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/E9BD25EA-FCB6-42E6-8B00-6EF03F159DE7-1.jpeg 1924w" width="1024"/>
           </figure>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text has-media-on-the-right is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              After getting to know Bali, we headed to the smaller neighbouring island, Nusa Lembongan. Here, all participants worked in groups on a topic of their choice related to wellbeing, happiness, and planning. For three days, the groups conducted interviews, surveys, and observations on topics such as seaweed farming, waste management, information infrastructure, and the impact of tourism on local culture.
             </p>
            </div>
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1833 size-full" decoding="async" height="712" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/D1C46A79-6CB4-461E-A8EE-0885D7A1F071-1024x712.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/D1C46A79-6CB4-461E-A8EE-0885D7A1F071-1024x712.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/D1C46A79-6CB4-461E-A8EE-0885D7A1F071-300x209.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/D1C46A79-6CB4-461E-A8EE-0885D7A1F071-768x534.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/D1C46A79-6CB4-461E-A8EE-0885D7A1F071.jpeg 1196w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <p>
            This has been a valuable opportunity for hands-on, first-hand insight and understanding of sustainable practices and the complexities of tourism. This hands-on experience provided invaluable first-hand insights into the challenges and opportunities on a small island with continuously growing tourism. By directly engaging with local communities and their unique contexts, participants bridged the gap between theory and practice. This immersive learning approach has undoubtedly enriched their perspectives on wellbeing, happiness, and planning in island settings!
           </p>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1835 size-full" decoding="async" height="1024" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/9DF14435-05A2-4CAE-B222-3EF6597BD7C1-1-768x1024.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/9DF14435-05A2-4CAE-B222-3EF6597BD7C1-1-768x1023.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/9DF14435-05A2-4CAE-B222-3EF6597BD7C1-1-225x300.jpeg 225w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/9DF14435-05A2-4CAE-B222-3EF6597BD7C1-1-810x1080.jpeg 810w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/9DF14435-05A2-4CAE-B222-3EF6597BD7C1-1.jpeg 944w" width="768"/>
            </figure>
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              On the last day, all groups presented their exciting fieldwork projects. This was followed by inspiring keynote sessions by Prof Sri Maryati from Institut
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/stt-bandung/">
               Universitas Teknologi Bandung
              </a>
              , Dr Manuel Florencio da Conossa Vong from
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/dittimorleste/">
               Dili Institute of Technology
              </a>
              , Prof
              <a href="https://www.rug.nl/staff/d.ballas/">
               Dimitris Ballas
              </a>
              from
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/faculty-of-spatial-sciences/">
               University of Groningen – Faculty of Spatial Sciences
              </a>
              and
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/islandsmaster/">
               ISLANDS MSc
              </a>
              , and Dr
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAABKQsCMBxvZTt0MB2vVlpu0ZVWH7lqjrnZQ">
               Luh Yusni Wiarti
              </a>
              from
              <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/politeknik-pariwisata-bali/">

              . The day concluded with an award ceremony celebrating the best presentations, videos, pictures, and more! The evening ended with a farewell dinner, featuring a breathtaking sunset and a mesmerising Balinese dance performance.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <figure class="wp-block-gallery has-nested-images columns-default is-cropped wp-block-gallery-1 is-layout-flex wp-block-gallery-is-layout-flex">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1836" data-id="1836" decoding="async" height="693" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-1024x693.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-1024x693.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-300x203.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-768x520.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-1536x1040.jpeg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-2048x1387.jpeg 2048w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/C26177E2-21C5-437F-835E-E47B4138723D-1595x1080.jpeg 1595w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1837" data-id="1837" decoding="async" height="648" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-1024x648.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-1024x648.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-300x190.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-768x486.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-1536x972.jpeg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-2048x1295.jpeg 2048w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B0BB3283-0B2F-4446-8E86-04F74A640113-1707x1080.jpeg 1707w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </figure>
           <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
           <p>
            We’ve gathered testimonials from participants who share their personal experiences and insights!
           </p>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1838 size-full" decoding="async" height="1024" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363-768x1024.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363-768x1024.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363-225x300.jpeg 225w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363-1152x1536.jpeg 1152w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363-1024x1365.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363-810x1080.jpeg 810w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/14E8879A-3C7B-4F96-8EC1-D10927C8B363.jpeg 1200w" width="768"/>
            </figure>
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              Hello, my name is Muhammad Ilmannafi. I am a third-year undergraduate student studying financial management at the University of Indonesia. Recently, I had the incredible opportunity to participate in the Summer/Winter School held in Bali, focusing on small island planning and quality of life. Despite my studies not being directly related to the program, my passion for geography and a desire to explore island potential drew me in.
             </p>
             <p>
              During the program, we were divided into groups, and my group’s research centered on the shrimp farming potential of Nusa Lembongan Island. This project allowed me to delve into the local economy and discover numerous untapped opportunities that required financial support, linking back to my field of study. The experience of researching and exploring the island was immensely enriching.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <p>
            Beyond the academic insights, I also had the pleasure of learning about the local people, culture, and the stunning beauty of the island. This adventure wasn’t just educational but also deeply enjoyable, as I made new friends, some of whom have become very close to me.
           </p>
           <p>
            Participating in this summer school has broadened my horizons, combining my interest in geography with my financial studies, and I look forward to joining similar programs in the future to further expand my knowledge and experience.
           </p>
           <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1839 size-full" decoding="async" height="1024" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 969px) 100vw, 969px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13-969x1024.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13-969x1024.jpeg 969w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13-284x300.jpeg 284w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13-768x812.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13-1024x1082.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13-1022x1080.jpeg 1022w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/B5F363D1-D52B-4EF9-AC5C-1135B757FC13.jpeg 1200w" width="969"/>
            </figure>
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              My name is Chiara, I am an Italian student currently attending the master’s degree Territory, Tourism and Local Development at Milano-Bicocca University.
             </p>
             <p>
              I was introduced to the study of islands during my bachelor’s degree, when I carried out my internship and degree thesis by conducting field research about the sustainability of community-based tourism in the Republic of the Maldives.
             </p>
             <p>
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <p>
            During my current master’s degree studies, I have had the opportunity to further my studies on islands and in particular human geography and sustainability. Thus, the winter/summer school “Islands as Laboratories for Sustainability (ISLAs)”, presented itself as a great opportunity to increase my knowledge on the subject and to get to know new contexts such as the Indonesian and Balinese one. Indeed, island contexts around the world appear to be very diverse, and learning about new issues and challenges that characterise different contexts is always enriching.
           </p>
           <p>
            In particular, the ISLAs school gave me the opportunity to work with people having different academic backgrounds and to understand the problems and challenges of the context from the point of view of the community, which is something very important that makes the experience truly enriching. Also, conversations and exchanges I have had with other participants were important insights and made me think about numerous opportunities we have and future collaborations that may arise, creating a network of young students with an interest on islands and hopefully future researchers in island studies.
           </p>
           <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1840 size-full" decoding="async" height="680" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/43F8D9C6-AC49-4B22-868D-3B1909C3A62A-1024x680.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/43F8D9C6-AC49-4B22-868D-3B1909C3A62A-1024x680.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/43F8D9C6-AC49-4B22-868D-3B1909C3A62A-300x199.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/43F8D9C6-AC49-4B22-868D-3B1909C3A62A-768x510.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/43F8D9C6-AC49-4B22-868D-3B1909C3A62A.jpeg 1210w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              Hi! My name is Faidah Mardika (Faidah), and I earned a master’s degree in public policy from the School of Government and Public Policy (SGPP Indonesia). Recently, I have been involved as a GEDSI Expert in the Indonesia Digital Ecosystem Assessment’s Archipelagic and Island State Forum (AIS Forum) for tourism and blue economy development in Indonesia. Apart from that, I work as a monitoring and evaluation consultant for various environmental programs specializing in issues of waste management, pollution, climate mitigation-adaptation, and promoting inclusive development.
             </p>
             <p>
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <p>
            Participating in this program is a pleasant experience. The program is able to equip us with various perspectives in studying small island and coastal community development trends. This was not only conveyed through the lecture sessions given. Discussions with lecturers and between participants during the program are also an important process since we come from different professional backgrounds with rich experiences. Opportunity to immerse ourself in reality of island community’s life by conducting a research complementing the learning process. We can learn from each other about the complexity of the problems, challenges and potential of the island and its community.
           </p>
           <p>
            How this program combines economic, tourism, environmental, sustainability as well as social and psychological aspects of the community has provided insights that have made us re-think the current state and how the future direction of small island and coastal development should be carried out. This learning output is essential to be utilized in working with the community.
           </p>
           <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
           <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile">
            <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-1849 size-full" decoding="async" height="683" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-1024x683.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-1024x683.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-300x200.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-768x512.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-1536x1024.jpeg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-2048x1366.jpeg 2048w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/45EC26C0-C78A-4E49-A009-2C44D5B7A93E-1620x1080.jpeg 1620w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
            <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
             <p>
              Warm greetings to all! My name is Naimah Putri Kamila, but people call me Mila. Being part of the organizing committee for the Winter School 2024 was an incredible experience. As a member of the School of Architecture, Planning, and Policy Development (SAPPD) at Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB), I was entrusted with the responsibility of preparing and conducting the program, with a particular focus on design and academic aspects.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <p>
            For approximately seven days, I assisted participants and lecturers at the Winter School (it is currently winter in Indonesia). I am very grateful for the chance to learn so much about small island planning, which is very important in today’s world. I was also delighted to meet and learn from inspiring individuals from all over the world. This exchange of ideas not only expanded my professional network but also deepened my appreciation for diverse perspectives in urban planning. The collaborative spirit and enthusiasm of everyone involved made the Winter School a truly memorable and rewarding experience.
           </p>
           <p>
            My involvement in the Winter School 2024 was a profound learning journey that significantly enhanced my academic and professional growth. I am excited to apply the insights I gained to future projects and contribute to the field of urban planning and design.
           </p>
           <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
           <p>
            And finally a travel diary entry from our ISLAND student, Luthfi, sharing his experiences.
           </p>
           <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-1841" decoding="async" height="540" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/57799FA1-E4F9-4813-8F9D-F42F888D9AE2-1024x540.jpeg" srcset="https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/57799FA1-E4F9-4813-8F9D-F42F888D9AE2-1024x540.jpeg 1024w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/57799FA1-E4F9-4813-8F9D-F42F888D9AE2-300x158.jpeg 300w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/57799FA1-E4F9-4813-8F9D-F42F888D9AE2-768x405.jpeg 768w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/57799FA1-E4F9-4813-8F9D-F42F888D9AE2-1536x809.jpeg 1536w, https://islandsmaster.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/57799FA1-E4F9-4813-8F9D-F42F888D9AE2.jpeg 1594w" width="1024"/>
           </figure>
           <p>
            Hi! My name is Luthfi Muhamad Iqbal, and I am a recently graduated ISLANDS students. From Monday, June 17, 2024, to Sunday, June 23, 2024, I participated in the ISLAs Summer School in Bali. During the first part of the program, we visited Panglipuran Traditional Village and had lunch overlooking the Batur Caldera, a UNESCO Global Geopark. We learned about the Tri Hita Karana Philosophy, which emphasizes the importance of maintaining harmonious relationships with spirituality (Parahyangan), humanity (Pawongan), and nature (Palemahan) for sustainability and quality of life.
           </p>
           <p>
            In the afternoon, we enjoyed a sunset at Melasti Beach. The next day, we traveled to Nusa Lembongan, a smaller island southeast of Bali, connected to Nusa Ceningan by a yellow bridge. We conducted a three-day fieldwork project exploring the islands and interviewing 10 locals, including a paddlewoman, seaweed farmer, tourist taxi driver, and other profession as well. Their stories, especially about the hardships faced during COVID-19 and the difficulties with fossil fuel dependence, were deeply touching.
           </p>
           <p>
            Our group, consisting of two students from Universiti Sains Malaysia, one from ITB (originally from Timor Leste), and myself from RUG, was mentored by Dr. Shida from USM. She introduced us to Doxey’s Irritation Index (Irridex), which was new to me. We spatialized our qualitative data into a map of irritation for Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Ceningan, presenting our findings on the final day, Saturday, June 22, 2024. Our presentation, titled “Happiness Oriented Planning Efforts (HOPE) for Sustainable Small Island Tourism: The Case of Nusa Lembongan,” won the award for best presentation. Inspired by the local saying “Astungkara,” meaning “God willing,” our work reflected the islanders’ hope for a better future.
           </p>
           <p>
            Researching on, for, and with island communities offers a unique and enriching perspective that resonates with my experiences at the ISLAs Summer School in Bali. We engaged in a holistic method that expanded our understanding and empowered islanders by addressing their specific needs and aspirations. As researchers, we must avoid positioning ourselves as outsiders who presume to know what is best. Instead, we should approach our work with humility, listen actively, and amplify the voices of the islanders. This mindset fosters genuine collaboration and trust, leading to meaningful and sustainable outcomes. My time in Bali taught me that true research is a dialogue, not a monologue. It’s about learning from the community and co-creating solutions that honor their heritage and vision for the future. This experience enriched my professional skills and deepened my appreciation for the power of collaborative and contextual island research.
           </p>
           <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
           <p>
            If you want to see more pictures, videos, and participant testimonials head to the instagram profile
            <a href="https://www.instagram.com/winterschool.sappkitb?utm_source=ig_web_button_share_sheet&igsh=ZDNlZDc0MzIxNw==">
             @winterschool.sappkitb
            </a>
            by Institut Teknologi Bandung.
           </p>
           <p>
            This year’s ISLAs marked a significant milestone as our first summer school held outside Europe. We highly value this opportunity to expand our view and collaborations, and are happy to have given participants an immersive and hands-on learning experience that will leave lasting impressions. We plan to sustain the connections we’ve built and look forward to future collaborations.
           </p>
           <p>
            We also recommend you to stay updated on the Small Island Planning Winter School organised by Institut Teknologi Bandung by following their instagram profile
            <a href="https://www.instagram.com/winterschool.sappkitb?utm_source=ig_web_button_share_sheet&igsh=ZDNlZDc0MzIxNw==">
             @winterschool.sappkitb
            </a>
            , and stay tuned for their next Winter School!
           </p>
           <p>
            We want to extend a heartfelt thank you to our amazing co-organisers and collaborators. We also want to express our gratitude to the amazing group of participants from all over the world who made this summer school unforgettable!
           </p>
           <p>
            Stay tuned for ISLAs 2025, which will take place on another island somewhere else in the world! We are excited to share the details soon, so follow us and keep an eye on the ISLANDS website
            <a href="https://islandsmaster.eu">
             https://islandsmaster.eu
            </a>
            , social media platforms, and our summer school website
            <a href="https://www.rug.nl/education/summer-winter-schools/islands-and-sustainability/?lang=env">
             www.rug.nl/education/summer-winter-schools/islands-and-sustainability
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </div>

        (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
    
    
/* ]]> */

         <h2 class="">

         </h2>
         <p class="" style="text-align: left;">
          <i style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: start;">
           <span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 14.266666px; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">
            The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to
           </span>
          </i>
          <span lang="EN-US" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: start; font-size: 11pt; line-height: 15.693334px; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">
           <a data-cp-link="1" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/about-eacea/data-protection/student-privacy-statement_en" style="color: rgb(149, 79, 114);">
            <i>
             <span lang="EN-GB" style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 14.266666px;">
              this privacy statement
             </span>
            </i>
           </a>
          </span>
          <i style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: start;">
           <span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 14.266666px; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">
           </span>
          </i>
          <span style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; font-size: medium; text-align: start;">
          </span>
         </p>
         <h5 class="">
          Erasmus Mundus Joint Master degree programme ‘ISLANDS’
         </h5>
         <p class="lead" style="text-align: left;">
          The University of Groningen (UG) always handles your personal data with care; you must be able to trust that they will be processed lawfully and protected appropriately. The UG therefore wants to be transparent about what it does with your personal data. The policy for this is included in the document:
          <a class="fancybox-pdf" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://myuniversity.rug.nl/about-us/organization/rules-and-regulations/algemeen/general-policy-on-protection-of-personal-data-ug-v2.0-final-version.pdf" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://myuniversity.rug.nl/about-us/organization/rules-and-regulations/algemeen/general-policy-on-protection-of-personal-data-ug-v2.0-final-version.pdf" rel="noopener" target="lightbox">
           General policy on protection of personal data
          </a>
          . Here you can read in outline the vision and principles of the UG. In addition, there is a
          <a class="fancybox-pdf" data-cp-link="1" data-mce-href="https://www.rug.nl/about-us/organization/rules-and-regulations/algemeen/20180423-algemeen-privacyverklaring-rug.pdf" data-mce-selected="inline-boundary" href="https://www.rug.nl/about-us/organization/rules-and-regulations/algemeen/20180423-algemeen-privacyverklaring-rug.pdf" rel="noopener" target="lightbox">
           General Privacy Statement
          </a>
          . This statement informs you about how the UG processes your data and what rights you have.
         </p>

       <div class="row spaced-cols" data-type="row">
        <div class="col-sm-6">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">

            <i class="fa icon fa-bullseye bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Purpose of processing personal data:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Your data will be used for the following purposes:
– Determining your identity.
– Assessing your prior qualifications and suitability.
– To allow Erasmus+ to send you student satisfaction surveys.
– Conducting project administration and the assessment of grant spending.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">

            <i class="fa icon fa-legal bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Principles underlying the processing of data:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             We assess the eligibility of candidates in the public interest. We are required by law to maintain a proper project administration. Your data may also be further used for statistical analysis.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">

            <i class="fa icon fa-calendar bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Source document and retention periods:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             You can submit the application form. We use Formdesk. We will retain your data for up to two years (in case you are placed) or three months (in case you are not placed) after the procedure has been concluded.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-handshake-o bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Your rights:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             – Right to ask for an overview/removal or to be rectified of the personal data collected on you
– Right to data portability (data transfers)
– Right to restrict processing
– Right to object to the processing of your dat
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-desktop bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             In which systems do we store your data:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Your data will be (temporarily) stored on the UG-licensed version of Google Drive and afterwards archived on the University’s secured network drive. The partner universities receive your data via Unishare. Your data is also entered into the EU ‘Funding and Tenders portal’.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-6">
         <div class="card row-card bordered y-move">
          <div class="row">
           <div class="col-sm-fit icon-column">
            <i class="fa icon fa-connectdevelop bordered round color2">
            </i>
           </div>
           <div class="col-sm" data-type="column">
            <h5 class="color2">
             Categories of personal data:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Name, contact information, date and place of birth, home address and country of residence, gender, ID, nationality, emergency contact details, preference for placement, cv, motivation, prior qualifications, (academic) achievements, language proficiency.
            </p>

           </div>

            <h5 class="color2">
             Recipients of your personal data:
            </h5>
            <p class="">
             Your data will be handled by the members of the ISLANDS Programme Eligibility and Selection Committee, which consists of members of all partner universities (Universities of Groningen, Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Aegean, and Iceland). Your data will also be shared with the European Committee.
            </p>

     <div class="content-section content-section-spacing" data-export-id="initial-content-section" data-id="initial-content-section" data-label="Cookie Policy" id="cookie-policy">
      <div class="gridContainer">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12">
         <h3>
          About this cookie policy
         </h3>
         <div>
          This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are and how we use them, the types of cookies we use i.e, the information we collect using cookies and how that information is used, and how to control the cookie preferences. For further information on how we use, store, and keep your personal data secure, see our Privacy Policy.

You can at any time change or withdraw your consent from the Cookie Declaration on our website
Learn more about who we are, how you can contact us, and how we process personal data in our Privacy Policy.
Your consent applies to the following domains: islandsmaster.eu
         </div>
         <h3>
          What are cookies ?
         </h3>
         <div>
          Cookies are small text files that are used to store small pieces of information. They are stored on your device when the website is loaded on your browser. These cookies help us make the website function properly, make it more secure, provide better user experience, and understand how the website performs and to analyze what works and where it needs improvement.
         </div>
         <h3>
          How do we use cookies ?
         </h3>
         <div>
          As most of the online services, our website uses first-party and third-party cookies for several purposes. First-party cookies are mostly necessary for the website to function the right way, and they do not collect any of your personally identifiable data.

The third-party cookies used on our website are mainly for understanding how the website performs, how you interact with our website, keeping our services secure, providing advertisements that are relevant to you, and all in all providing you with a better and improved user experience and help speed up your future interactions with our website.
         </div>
         <h3>
          What types of cookies do we use ?
         </h3>
         <div>
          <strong>
           Essential
          </strong>
          : Some cookies are essential for you to be able to experience the full functionality of our site. They allow us to maintain user sessions and prevent any security threats. They do not collect or store any personal information. For example, these are cookies that are needed when using the log-in functionality of the website.
         </div>
         <div>
          <strong>
           Statistics
          </strong>
          : These cookies store information like the number of visitors to the website, the number of unique visitors, which pages of the website have been visited, the source of the visit, etc. These data help us understand and analyze how well the website performs and where it needs improvement. Our statistics are stored on our own web server and do not use third-party services.
         </div>
         <div>
          <strong>
           Marketing
          </strong>
          : Our website does not use cookies for marketing purposes.
         </div>
         <div>
          <strong>
           Functional
          </strong>
          : These are the cookies that help certain non-essential functionalities on our website. These functionalities include embedding content like videos or sharing content of the website on social media platforms.
         </div>
         <div>
          <strong>
           Preferences
          </strong>
          : These cookies help us store your settings and browsing preferences like language preferences so that you have a better and efficient experience on future visits to the website.
         </div>
         <div>
         </div>
         <div>
         </div>
         <h3>
          How can I control the cookie preferences ?
         </h3>
         <div>
          Should you decide to change your preferences later through your browsing session, you can click on the “Cookie & Privacy Policy” page for this website. This will display the consent notice again enabling you to change your preferences or withdraw your consent entirely.
         </div>
         <div>
          View your settings here: 

In addition to this, different browsers provide different methods to block and delete cookies used by websites. You can change the settings of your browser to block/delete the cookies. To find out more about how to manage and delete cookies, visit
          <a class="" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_cookie" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
           wikipedia.org
          </a>
          ,
          <a class="" href="http://www.allaboutcookies.org" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
           www.allaboutcookies.org.
          </a>
         </div>
        </div>
        <!-- /wp:html -->
        <!-- wp:paragraph -->
        <!-- /wp:paragraph -->
       </div>
      </div>
